results.title: Square pegs
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation and John Mansfield
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Today, applying for a job often means submitting to innumerable tests, not only of ability and intelligence, but also of personality. But just how valid are these tests? This program examines some of the techniques used by the boom industry of Management Selection and follows two candidates through their ordeal.

results.title: The Real bionic man
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation and Stuart Harris
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Looks at the space part surgery business, of which the very fundamental technical problems remain to be solved after thirty-five years. Only very simple artificial limbs are possible. Hospitals and medical centres are visited in search of bionic man and finally the program tries to visualise what an actual bionic man would look like.

results.title: Portrait of a poison
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
The chemical revolution since World War II has introduced a new family of poisons- man-made, invisible, powerful, little understood, totally useless but totally devastating. The most deadly of these is dioxin, a by-product in the manufacture of certain herbicides such as Agent Orange and 245T. Narrated by Paul Vaughan.

results.title: The Chemical dream
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation and Edward Goldwyn
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Looks at the research and utilization of enzymes in industry and the mass production of bacteria that produce specific enzymes. Also the production of sugar from carbohydrate source is discussed, together with its implications in the sugar-cane industry. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Moving still
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Uses archival material to show the development of early photography, from the first photograph of 1827 through to the first slow motion study in 1901. Also illustrates how scientists, designers and engineers use time-lapse cameras to cheat time; to look beyond our human perceptions; and to study the world of high and low-speed activity.

results.title: Contented cows and other aninmals
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Humans have bred and kept farm animals, as a food supply, for a long time. Particularly in commercial production situations, the way in which the animals are housed is a result of economic factors rather than a concern for the animals’ welfare. This documentary looks at studies which are trying to determine how to look after animals’ well-being and maintain productivity.

results.title: The Life that lives on man
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation and Michael Andrews
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Skin, for all its accessibility is one of the least studied organs of the body. Looks at the whole ecology of bacteria, yeasts and animals, which are a human being’s intimate companions through life.

results.title: How do you read? (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation, Stephen Rose and Harris Watts
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Being unable to read is a personal disaster. Learning to read at an early age is very important. This film demonstrates various modern techniques and devices used to increase reading speed, and it shows that the speed of reading and the rate of comprehension are related to the material being studied.

results.title: Mind over body
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
A survey of the research done to study how our mental activities affect the development of illness in our lives, and the development of technique by which patients can be taught to use the activity of the mind to produce bodily changes in some of the physiological systems that are most associated with the onset of illness. Also discusses biofeedback - the control of the electrical activity of the brain.
